intro: Dumaniana glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular dumaniana, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its unique morphology includes stipules that are often glandular and persistent. Dumaniana glandulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
